briefdescription.para: constructor for the stepper class
connect the stepper object to the IO pins

parameterdescription.para: IO pin number for the Step
IO pin number for the direction bit
IO pin number for the enable bit (LOW is enabled). set to 0 if enable is not supported

briefdescription.para: set the number of steps the motor has per millimeters
get the current position of the motor in millimeters, this functions is updated while the motor moves

simplesect.para: a signed motor position in millimeters returned

briefdescription.para: set the current position of the motor in millimeters, this does not move the motor
set the maximum speed, units in millimeters/second, this is the maximum speed reached while accelerating

parameterdescription.para: speed to accelerate up to, units in millimeters/second

briefdescription.para: set the rate of acceleration, units in millimeters/second/second

parameterdescription.para: accelerationInMillimetersPerSecondPerSecond = rate of acceleration, units in millimeters/second/second

memberdef.argsstring: (long directionTowardHome, float speedInMillimetersPerSecond, long maxDistanceToMoveInMillimeters, int homeLimitSwitchPin)
memberdef.name: moveToHomeInMillimeters

briefdescription.para: home the motor by moving until the homing sensor is activated, then set the position to zero, with units in millimeters

parameterdescription.para: 1 to move in a positive direction, -1 to move in a negative directions
speed to accelerate up to while moving toward home, units in millimeters/second
unsigned maximum distance to move toward home before giving up
pin number of the home switch, switch should be configured to go low when at home

simplesect.para: true returned if successful, else false

briefdescription.para: move relative to the current position, units are in millimeters, this function does not return until the move is complete

parameterdescription.para: signed distance to move relative to the current position in millimeters

briefdescription.para: setup a move relative to the current position, units are in millimeters, no motion occurs until processMove() is called

parameterdescription.para: signed distance to move relative to the current position in millimeters

briefdescription.para: move to the given absolute position, units are in millimeters, this function does not return until the move is complete

parameterdescription.para: signed absolute position to move to in units of millimeters

briefdescription.para: setup a move, units are in millimeters, no motion occurs until processMove() is called

parameterdescription.para: signed absolute position to move to in units of millimeters

briefdescription.para: Get the current velocity of the motor in millimeters/second.

detaileddescription.para: This functions is updated while it accelerates up and down in speed. This is not the desired speed, but the speed the motor should be moving at the time the function is called. This is a signed value and is negative when the motor is moving backwards. Note: This speed will be incorrect if the desired velocity is set faster than this library can generate steps, or if the load on the motor is too great for the amount of torque that it can generate.

simplesect.para: float velocity speed in steps per second returned, signed

briefdescription.para: set the number of steps the motor has per revolution
set the current position of the motor in revolutions, this does not move the motor
get the current position of the motor in revolutions, this functions is updated while the motor moves

parameterdescription.para: a signed motor position in revolutions returned

briefdescription.para: set the maximum speed, units in revolutions/second, this is the maximum speed reached while accelerating

parameterdescription.para: speed to accelerate up to, units in revolutions/second

briefdescription.para: set the rate of acceleration, units in revolutions/second/second

parameterdescription.para: rate of acceleration, units in revolutions/second/second

memberdef.argsstring: (long directionTowardHome, float speedInRevolutionsPerSecond, long maxDistanceToMoveInRevolutions, int homeLimitSwitchPin)
memberdef.name: moveToHomeInRevolutions

briefdescription.para: home the motor by moving until the homing sensor is activated, then set the position to zero, with units in revolutions

parameterdescription.para: 1 to move in a positive direction, -1 to move in a negative directions
speed to accelerate up to while moving toward home, units in revolutions/second
unsigned maximum distance to move toward home before giving up
pin number of the home switch, switch should be configured to go low when at home

simplesect.para: true returned if successful, else false

briefdescription.para: move relative to the current position, units are in revolutions, this function does not return until the move is complete

parameterdescription.para: signed distance to move relative to the current position in revolutions

briefdescription.para: setup a move relative to the current position, units are in revolutions, no motion occurs until processMove() is called

parameterdescription.para: signed distance to move relative to the currentposition in revolutions

briefdescription.para: move to the given absolute position, units are in revolutions, this function does not return until the move is complete

parameterdescription.para: signed absolute position to move to in units of revolutions

briefdescription.para: setup a move, units are in revolutions, no motion occurs until processMove() is called

parameterdescription.para: signed absolute position to move to in units of revolutions

briefdescription.para: Get the current velocity of the motor in revolutions/second.

detaileddescription.para: This functions is updated while it accelerates up and down in speed. This is not the desired speed, but the speed the motor should be moving at the time the function is called. This is a signed value and is negative when the motor is moving backwards. Note: This speed will be incorrect if the desired velocity is set faster than this library can generate steps, or if the load on the motor is too great for the amount of torque that it can generate.

simplesect.para: velocity speed in steps per second returned, signed

briefdescription.para: set the current position of the motor in steps, this does not move the motor

simplesect.para: Note: This function should only be called when the motor is stopped

parameterdescription.para: the new position of the motor in steps

briefdescription.para: get the current position of the motor in steps, this functions is updated while the motor moves

simplesect.para: a signed motor position in steps returned

briefdescription.para: set the maximum speed, units in steps/second, this is the maximum speed reached while accelerating

parameterdescription.para: speed to accelerate up to, units in steps/second

briefdescription.para: set the rate of acceleration, units in steps/second/second

parameterdescription.para: rate of acceleration, units in steps/second/second

memberdef.argsstring: (long directionTowardHome, float speedInStepsPerSecond, long maxDistanceToMoveInSteps, int homeSwitchPin)
memberdef.name: moveToHomeInSteps

briefdescription.para: home the motor by moving until the homing sensor is activated, then set the position to zero with units in steps

parameterdescription.para: 1 to move in a positive direction, -1 to move in a negative directions
speed to accelerate up to while moving toward home, units in steps/second
unsigned maximum distance to move toward home before giving up
pin number of the home switch, switch should be configured to go low when at home

simplesect.para: true returned if successful, else false

briefdescription.para: move relative to the current position, units are in steps, this function does not return until the move is complete

parameterdescription.para: signed distance to move relative to the current position in steps

briefdescription.para: setup a move relative to the current position, units are in steps, no motion occurs until processMove() is called

parameterdescription.para: signed distance to move relative to the current positionin steps

briefdescription.para: move to the given absolute position, units are in steps, this function does not return until the move is complete

parameterdescription.para: signed absolute position to move to in unitsof steps

briefdescription.para: setup a move, units are in steps, no motion occurs until processMove() is called

parameterdescription.para: signed absolute position to move to in units of steps

briefdescription.para: setup a "Stop" to begin the process of decelerating from the current velocity to zero, decelerating requires calls to processMove() until the move is complete

simplesect.para: Note: This function can be used to stop a motion initiated in units of steps or revolutions

briefdescription.para: check if the motor has competed its move to the target position

simplesect.para: true returned if the stepper is at the target position

briefdescription.para: Get the current velocity of the motor in steps/second.

detaileddescription.para: This functions is updated while it accelerates up and down in speed. This is not the desired speed, but the speed the motor should be moving at the time the function is called. This is a signed value and is negative when the motor is moving backwards. Note: This speed will be incorrect if the desired velocity is set faster than this library can generate steps, or if the load on the motor is too great for the amount of torque that it can generate.

simplesect.para: velocity speed in steps per second returned, signed

briefdescription.para: if it is time, move one step

simplesect.para: true returned if movement complete, false returned not a final target position yet

briefdescription.para: determine the period for the next step, either speed up a little, slow down a little or go the same speed
